intro: Sabicea johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's sabicea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in yellow or white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
